info.name: Concept & Hands-On Validation Platform
info.description:
Complete API collection for Concept-Based Validation and Hands-On Validation Code Generation.

## Validation Types:
1. **Concept-Based Validation** - Evaluate theory/concept answers from Word documents
2. **Hands-On Spring Boot Validation** - Generate Java validation code for Spring Boot assessments
3. **Hands-On AWS Cloud Validation** - Generate Python validation code for AWS assessments
4. **Hands-On Azure Cloud Validation** - Generate Python validation code for Azure assessments
5. **Hands-On GCP Cloud Validation** - Generate Python validation code for GCP assessments
6. **Hands-On Go Lang Validation** - Generate Python validation code for Go Lang REST API assessments with PostgreSQL

## Setup:
1. Start the server: `mvn spring-boot:run`
2. Base URL: `http://localhost:8080`
3. Swagger UI: `http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui.html`

request.description: Check if the concept validation service is running
Check if the hands-on validation service is running
Check GitHub integration configuration status

item.name: 1. Concept-Based Validation
item.description: APIs for evaluating concept/theory answers using LLM. Results are stored in GitHub.

request.description: Get the current validation configuration including questions
Get list of questions for validation

formdata.description: Configuration JSON with questions and GitHub settings

request.description:
Upload answer document (.docx) and config JSON for validation. Results are stored in GitHub.

**Steps:**
1. Select your .docx file for 'answerFile'
2. Update 'config' JSON with your questions
3. Send request
4. Check response for GitHub URL

body.raw:
{
  "assessmentId": "software-arch-002",
  "assessmentTitle": "Software Architecture Assessment",
  "userAnswersPath": "C:/Users/NernikaBoyaRaju/OneDrive - Nuvepro Technologies Private Limited/github/Capgemini-Concept-based-validation/Software Architecture Assessment3.docx",
  "defaultMaxMarks": 10,
  "githubConfig": {
    "repoName": "validation-results"
  },
  "questions": [
    {
      "id": "Q1",
      "description": "Architecture Selection (Client-Server and Layered Architecture)",
      "points": 10,
      "questionType": "text-only",
      "scenario": "You are hired as a Software Architect for a mid-size airline company planning to build an Airline Management System (AMS).",
      "question": "a) Propose a high-level architecture using Client-Server and Layered Architecture. b) Identify each layer and its responsibility. c) Explain why layered architecture is suitable.",
      "keyConcepts": ["client-server architecture", "layered architecture", "presentation layer", "business logic layer", "data access layer", "separation of concerns"],
      "expectedAnswer": "PART A - Proposed Architecture: Client-Server with Layered design on server side. Clients: Web browser (Customer UI), Internal Admin Portal. Server: Application Server, Database Server. PART B - Layers: Presentation Layer handles UI, Business Layer contains core business rules, Data Access Layer communicates with database. PART C - Why Suitable: Clear separation of concerns, easier maintenance and testing, business logic independent of UI."
    },
    {
      "id": "Q2",
      "description": "Diagram Interpretation (Error Spotting and Correction)",
      "points": 10,
      "questionType": "text-and-diagram",
      "textWeight": 70,
      "diagramWeight": 30,
      "scenario": "Below is a proposed architecture diagram: [UI Layer] -> [Database Layer] -> [Business Logic Layer]",
      "question": "a) Identify two architectural issues. b) Redraw the corrected layered architecture. c) Explain how the corrected version improves maintainability.",
      "keyConcepts": ["layered architecture", "separation of concerns", "maintainability", "proper layer ordering"],
      "expectedAnswer": "Issues: 1) Incorrect Layer Ordering - Business logic below Database. 2) Direct UI to Database connection. Corrected: [Presentation] -> [Business] -> [Data Access] -> [Database]. Improvements: Clear dependency direction, separation of concerns, easier testing.",
      "diagramCriteria": ["Presentation Layer at top", "Business Layer in second position", "Data Access Layer third", "Database at bottom"]
    },
    {
      "id": "Q3",
      "description": "Identifying Bounded Contexts (DDD)",
      "points": 8,
      "questionType": "text-only",
      "scenario": "Based on the AMS scenario: flight scheduling, ticket booking, passenger management, payment processing.",
      "question": "a) Identify at least four bounded contexts. b) For each context, mention: Core responsibility and Example entities.",
      "keyConcepts": ["bounded context", "domain-driven design", "flight management", "booking context", "payment context"],
      "expectedAnswer": "Bounded Contexts: 1) Booking Context - Ticket booking. Entities: Booking, Ticket. 2) Flight Management - Flight schedules. Entities: Flight, Aircraft. 3) Payment Context - Payment processing. Entities: Payment, Transaction. 4) User Management - Users and roles. Entities: User, Role."
    },
    {
      "id": "Q4",
      "description": "Tactical DDD Design (Booking Context)",
      "points": 8,
      "questionType": "text-only",
      "question": "a) Identify: Aggregate Root, Entities, Value Objects. b) Explain why this aggregate boundary is important.",
      "keyConcepts": ["aggregate root", "entities", "value objects", "aggregate boundary"],
      "expectedAnswer": "Aggregate Root: Booking. Entities: Passenger, Ticket. Value Objects: SeatNumber, Money, FlightDate. Importance: Ensures consistency during booking operations, prevents partial updates."
    }
  ]
}

request.description:
Validate using file path (when file is already on server). Useful for testing.

**Note:** Update 'userAnswersPath' to point to your actual .docx file location.
Quick validation with answers provided directly as JSON (no file upload). Uses questions from config.json.

item.name: 6. Hands-On Go Lang Validation
item.description: Generate Python validation code for Go Lang REST API assessments with PostgreSQL

body.raw:
{
  "skillType": "GOLANG_API",
  "projectName": "inventory-billing-system",
  "customInstructions": "Generate Python validation code following ValidateGoLangTemplate.py pattern with PostgreSQL validation",
  "testcases": [
    {
      "name": "Check for successful product creation",
      "description": "Verify POST /api/products creates product and stores in PostgreSQL",
      "endpoint": "/api/products",
      "httpMethod": "POST",
      "expectedStatusCode": 201,
      "marks": 10,
      "exampleInput": {"name": "Laptop", "price": 999, "quantity": 50},
      "exampleOutput": {"id": 1, "name": "Laptop", "price": 999, "quantity": 50},
      "tableName": "products"
    },
    {
      "name": "Check for successful product retrieval by id",
      "description": "Verify GET /api/products/{id} returns correct product",
      "endpoint": "/api/products/{id}",
      "httpMethod": "GET",
      "expectedStatusCode": 200,
      "marks": 10,
      "tableName": "products"
    },
    {
      "name": "Check for updating a product",
      "description": "Verify PUT /api/products/{id} updates product in database",
      "endpoint": "/api/products/{id}",
      "httpMethod": "PUT",
      "expectedStatusCode": 200,
      "marks": 10,
      "exampleInput": {"name": "Updated Laptop", "price": 1099, "quantity": 45},
      "tableName": "products"
    },
    {
      "name": "Check for deleting a product",
      "description": "Verify DELETE /api/products/{id} removes product from database",
      "endpoint": "/api/products/{id}",
      "httpMethod": "DELETE",
      "expectedStatusCode": 200,
      "marks": 10,
      "tableName": "products"
    },
    {
      "name": "Check for successful customer creation",
      "description": "Verify POST /api/customers creates customer",
      "endpoint": "/api/customers",
      "httpMethod": "POST",
      "expectedStatusCode": 201,
      "marks": 10,
      "exampleInput": {"name": "John Doe", "email": "john@example.com"},
      "exampleOutput": {"id": 1, "name": "John Doe", "email": "john@example.com"},
      "tableName": "customers"
    },
    {
      "name": "Check for retrieving all customers",
      "description": "Verify GET /api/customers returns all customers",
      "endpoint": "/api/customers",
      "httpMethod": "GET",
      "expectedStatusCode": 200,
      "marks": 10,
      "tableName": "customers"
    },
    {
      "name": "Check for successful billing creation",
      "description": "Verify POST /api/billing creates billing record (depends on product and customer)",
      "endpoint": "/api/billing",
      "httpMethod": "POST",
      "expectedStatusCode": 201,
      "marks": 10,
      "exampleInput": {"cust_id": 1, "prod_id": 1, "quantity": 2},
      "tableName": "billing",
      "dependsOn": ["Check for successful product creation", "Check for successful customer creation"]
    },
    {
      "name": "Check for updating quantity if product is already bought",
      "description": "Verify quantity updates when same product is bought again",
      "endpoint": "/api/billing",
      "httpMethod": "POST",
      "expectedStatusCode": 200,
      "marks": 10,
      "tableName": "billing",
      "dependsOn": ["Check for successful billing creation"]
    },
    {
      "name": "Check for retrieving all billings by customer id",
      "description": "Verify GET /api/billing/{custId} returns customer billings",
      "endpoint": "/api/billing/{custId}",
      "httpMethod": "GET",
      "expectedStatusCode": 200,
      "marks": 20,
      "tableName": "billing",
      "dependsOn": ["Check for successful billing creation"]
    }
  ]
}

request.description: Generate Python validation code for a complete Go Lang inventory and billing system
Generate Python validation code for Go Lang CRUD operations

body.raw:
{
  "skillType": "GOLANG_MICROSERVICES",
  "projectName": "ecommerce-microservices",
  "customInstructions": "Generate validation for two microservices: Product Service (port 8080) and Order Service (port 8081)",
  "testcases": [
    {
      "name": "Product Service - Create Product",
      "description": "Create product in Product Service",
      "endpoint": "/api/products",
      "httpMethod": "POST",
      "expectedStatusCode": 201,
      "marks": 10,
      "exampleInput": {"name": "Gadget", "price": 299, "quantity": 100}
    },
    {
      "name": "Product Service - Get All Products",
      "description": "Get all products from Product Service",
      "endpoint": "/api/products",
      "httpMethod": "GET",
      "expectedStatusCode": 200,
      "marks": 10
    },
    {
      "name": "Order Service - Create Order",
      "description": "Create order in Order Service (calls Product Service)",
      "endpoint": "/api/orders",
      "httpMethod": "POST",
      "expectedStatusCode": 201,
      "marks": 15,
      "exampleInput": {"product_id": 1, "customer_id": 1, "quantity": 2},
      "dependsOn": ["Product Service - Create Product"]
    },
    {
      "name": "Order Service - Get Orders by Customer",
      "description": "Get all orders for a customer",
      "endpoint": "/api/orders/customer/{id}",
      "httpMethod": "GET",
      "expectedStatusCode": 200,
      "marks": 10,
      "dependsOn": ["Order Service - Create Order"]
    },
    {
      "name": "Order Service - Verify Product Stock Reduction",
      "description": "Verify product quantity is reduced after order",
      "endpoint": "/api/products/{id}",
      "httpMethod": "GET",
      "expectedStatusCode": 200,
      "marks": 15,
      "dependsOn": ["Order Service - Create Order"]
    }
  ]
}
